annotations.description: Template for building an Apache HTTP Server (httpd) container image via GIT and S2I
annotations.openshift.io/long-description: This template defines buildconfig resources needed to develop a static application served by Apache HTTP Server (httpd)

message: The following service(s) have been created in your project: ${APPLICATION_NAME}.

annotations.description: Keeps track of changes in the application image

parameters.name: APPLICATION_NAME
parameters.description: The name assigned to all of the frontend objects defined in this template.

parameters.name: APPLICATION_ID
parameters.description: ID of the application the microservice belongs to

parameters.name: NAMESPACE
parameters.description: The OpenShift Namespace where the ImageStream resides.

parameters.name: BUILD_MEM_LIMIT
parameters.description: Maximum amount of memory the container can use.

parameters.name: BUILD_MEM_REQUEST
parameters.description: The requested memory for a build

parameters.name: BUILD_CPU_LIMIT
parameters.description: The limit of CPU to allow for a build

parameters.name: BUILD_CPU_REQUEST
parameters.description: The requested CPU for a build.

parameters.name: GIT_REPO_URL
parameters.description: The URL of the repository with your application source code.

parameters.name: GIT_REPO_BRANCH
parameters.description: Set this to a branch name, tag or other ref of your repository if you are not using the default branch.

parameters.name: GIT_CONTEXT_DIR
parameters.description: Set this to the relative path to your project if it is not in the root of your repository.

parameters.name: GITHUB_SECRET
parameters.description: Github trigger secret.  A difficult to guess string encoded as part of the webhook URL.  Not encrypted.

parameters.name: GENERIC_WEBHOOK_SECRET
parameters.description: A secret string used to configure the Generic webhook.
